Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.182)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36424) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36424)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 282 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13470 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
